name: The Best French Toast
description: Fluffy and tender on the inside and golden crisp outside, the best French Toast we‘ve ever tasted was during a trip to Japan. I‘ve recreated it here following the chef‘s recipe and tips. Now, you can make this amazing dish at home for breakfast or brunch!

video.name: How to Make Amazing French Toast フレンチトーストの作り方 (レシピ)
video.description:
Fluffy and tender on the inside, and golden crisp on the outside, this is the best French Toast we’ve tasted during our trip to Japan last summer. I’ve re-created this amazing French toast by following the chef’s recipe! Make it this weekend for breakfast or brunch! 

RECIPE starts ▶ 00:42

PRINT RECIPE ▶ http://bit.ly/BestFrenchToastRecipe

Prep Time 15 mins
Cook Time 20 mins
Total Time 35 mins
Servings: 4

INGREDIENTS

3 large eggs
¼ cup sugar (60 g)
½ tsp vanilla extract
2 ½ cup whole milk (600 ml)
1 French baguette
2 Tbsp unsalted butter

- To Serve -
confectioners’ sugar/powdered sugar (if desired)
maple syrup (if desired)

INSTRUCTIONS with step-by-step pics ▶ http://bit.ly/BestFrenchToastRecipe

#frenchtoast #フレンチトースト #鬼怒川温泉あさやホテル #breakfast #justonecookbook

How to Make Amazing French Toast フレンチトーストの作り方 (レシピ)

recipeIngredient: 3  large eggs (50 g each w/o shell)

itemListElement.text: In a large bowl, beat 3 large eggs (50 g each w/o shell).
itemListElement.name: In a large bowl, beat 3 large eggs (50 g each w/o shell).

itemListElement.text: Add ¼ cup sugar and ½ tsp pure vanilla extract. Whisk well to combine.
itemListElement.name: Add ¼ cup sugar and ½ tsp pure vanilla extract. Whisk well to combine.

itemListElement.text: Add 2½ cups whole milk and whisk well together.
itemListElement.name: Add 2½ cups whole milk and whisk well together.

itemListElement.text: Cut 1 French baguette into pieces 1½–2 inches (4–5 cm) thick.
itemListElement.name: Cut 1 French baguette into pieces 1½–2 inches (4–5 cm) thick.

itemListElement.text: Dip each piece into the bowl with the custard mixture, soaking both sides of the bread. Then, place each soaked baguette slice in a deep baking dish, with the soft white side facing up.
itemListElement.name: Dip each piece into the bowl with the custard mixture, soaking both sides of the bread. Then, place each soaked baguette slice in a deep baking dish, with the soft white side facing up.

itemListElement.text: Pour the leftover custard mixture into the baking dish.
itemListElement.name: Pour the leftover custard mixture into the baking dish.

itemListElement.text: Soak in the custard mixture for 5 minutes. Then, flip to soak the other side for 5 minutes. The side facing up now is the “dry” side. While waiting for the baguette to soak, prepare your toppings (optional) like fruit, powdered sugar, and maple syrup.
itemListElement.name: Soak in the custard mixture for 5 minutes. Then, flip to soak the other side for 5 minutes. The side facing up now is the “dry” side. While waiting for the baguette to soak, prepare your toppings (optional) like fruit, powdered sugar, and maple syrup.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven to 350ºF (180ºC). Grease the rimmed baking sheet with butter. Heat 2 Tbsp unsalted butter in a large frying pan or griddle.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven to 350ºF (180ºC). Grease the rimmed baking sheet with butter. Heat 2 Tbsp unsalted butter in a large frying pan or griddle.

itemListElement.text: When the butter is melted and the pan is hot, place the bread in the pan, “dry” side DOWN. The “dry” side is the side facing up in the baking dish (the first side that you soaked).
itemListElement.name: When the butter is melted and the pan is hot, place the bread in the pan, “dry” side DOWN. The “dry” side is the side facing up in the baking dish (the first side that you soaked).

itemListElement.text: Cook until the bottom is golden brown. Then, turn over to cook the other side until golden.
itemListElement.name: Cook until the bottom is golden brown. Then, turn over to cook the other side until golden.

itemListElement.text: When both sides are nicely browned, transfer to the baking sheet.
itemListElement.name: When both sides are nicely browned, transfer to the baking sheet.

itemListElement.text: Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for 6 minutes. For a convection oven, reduce the cooking temperature by 25ºF (15ºC).
itemListElement.name: Bake at 350ºF (180ºC) for 6 minutes. For a convection oven, reduce the cooking temperature by 25ºF (15ºC).

itemListElement.text: Remove from the oven and serve on a plate.
itemListElement.name: Remove from the oven and serve on a plate.

itemListElement.text: Add the toppings of your choice (optional). I sprinkled confectioners’ sugar and drizzled maple syrup on top and served with strawberries and blackberries. Enjoy!
itemListElement.name: Add the toppings of your choice (optional). I sprinkled confectioners’ sugar and drizzled maple syrup on top and served with strawberries and blackberries. Enjoy!

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for a month.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days and in the freezer for a month.

review.reviewBody: I like to try different recipes for my kids and so far this one is their favorite for french toast. They ask for this recipe specifically now. Thanks for sharing! So tasty
I microwaved the frozen leftover and that worked well.
Fantastic easy recipe, perfect for entertaining, a special breakfast or just anytime.  I’ve made this many times now and love it!
This was very good.  I used 2 different baguettes - sourdough and sweet French.  The sourdough did not mesh well with the egg mixture.  The sweet French baguette worked well with the egg mixture.
Fantastic! It’s a new family favourite ❤️
Really good, Skipping the cinnamon lets the subtle flavor of the butter and vanilla show. Should I use a stale baguette as usual for French toast or a fresh one?
Oh my!  I am IN LOVE!  This is the best recipe for French toast using day old baguette.    As stated, crispy on the outside and wonderfully soft inside!  And very flavorful.

Great French Toast recipe, l cut a slot in the bread slice and added a generous spoonful of a mixture of ricotta, lemon zest, vanilla and a tsp of honey to the cavity created by the slot. Worked well.
